messages.message:
Invoking: `validate` with `{'patch': '--- a/src/popupmenu.c
+++ b/src/popupmenu.c
@@ -844,7 +844,10 @@
-                    MB_PTR_BACK(st, st_end);
+                    if (st_end > st)
+                        MB_PTR_BACK(st, st_end);
+                    if (st_end < st)
+                        st_end = st;
@@ -852,7 +855,10 @@
-                    MB_PTR_BACK(st, st_end);
+                    if (st_end > st)
+                        MB_PTR_BACK(st, st_end);
+                    if (st_end < st)
+                        st_end = st;
'}`
responded: The previous patch did not fully prevent the out-of-bounds access, because the macro `MB_PTR_BACK(st, st_end)` can still be called when `st_end == st`, and inside the macro, it does `(*mb_head_off)(st, st_end - 1)`, which is out-of-bounds.

**The correct fix is:**
- Before calling `MB_PTR_BACK(st, st_end)`, ensure that `st_end > st`.
- Also, after the macro, ensure `st_end >= st` (never less).
- Critically, in the second use (line 852), the same check must be applied.

Let's patch both locations (lines 844 and 852) to only call `MB_PTR_BACK(st, st_end)` if `st_end > st`.
